sections.title: Introduction — local unit test vs cloud agent
sections.summary: Speaker contrasts a locally implemented unit test (quick) with the option to have an agent work in the cloud to implement missing unit tests.
key_actions: Describe local implementation time for AI search unit test
Propose using a cloud-isolated agent to implement missing unit tests

sections.title: Enable GitHub tools and search issues
sections.summary: Speaker enables GitHub tools (via MCP) and runs a search to check if there are repository issues related to missing unit tests; grants permission to execute the tool.
key_actions: Enable GitHub tools at MCP
Allow execution/permission for the search tool
Search issues in repository for missing unit tests

sections.title: Issue #18 identified (missing unit tests)
sections.summary: An open issue (#18) is found requesting missing unit tests for products, store and domain entities. The issue includes scope, acceptance criteria, tasks, labels and other metadata.
key_actions: Open issue #18 in repository
Review issue scope, acceptance criteria, and tasks
ui_elements: Labels, scope and acceptance criteria sections

sections.title: Assign GitHub Copilot to the issue (via GitHub or Visual Studio)
sections.summary: Demonstrates two options to assign the work: use GitHub (preferred) or directly from Visual Studio. The speaker issues a command to assign Copilot to issue #18.
key_actions: Choose assignment method (GitHub or Visual Studio)
Assign Copilot to issue #18

sections.title: Pull request created and cloud session started
sections.summary: After assignment, Copilot starts creating a pull request and performs work isolated in the cloud: creating environment, getting a fork and interacting with GitHub/CP servers. The process may take time.
key_actions: Observe PR creation
Open PR details/session
Monitor environment creation and fork steps

sections.title: Review previous PR (#17) and changed files
sections.summary: Speaker inspects a previously completed PR (#17) to see what Copilot produced: new unit tests for product and store, file changes and implementation notes.
key_actions: Open previous PR (#17)
View changed files and newly added test files
Examine technical implementation notes
ui_elements: File tree showing new test files (products test, store test)

sections.title: Session log and duration details
sections.summary: Speaker highlights the session duration (~18 minutes) and the recorded steps: cloning the repository, making a plan, viewing source code — all recorded in the session log.
key_actions: Open session log
Read step-by-step actions recorded by Copilot
ui_elements: Recorded steps list (get repository, make a plan, view source code)

sections.title: Review current PR progress and GitHub Actions CI
sections.summary: Speaker inspects the ongoing PR triggered by Copilot, watches the GitHub Actions run (CI) which streams a full log of the process — useful for debugging and validation.
key_actions: Open PR details for current/ongoing PR
Monitor GitHub Actions workflow and logs
Review Copilot-proposed changes

main_topics: Using GitHub Copilot / cloud agents to implement missing unit tests
Searching for and managing repository issues
Assigning Copilot to an issue (GitHub or Visual Studio)
Automated pull request creation and cloud-isolated work sessions
Reviewing file changes and session logs
